backend/main.mo: Defines the main actor for a program application system supporting three programs (AI Infrastructure, AI Data Analytics, QA Testing), with functions to submit, retrieve, and list application forms stored in a map.
backend/migration.mo: Handles data migration from an older actor state (two programs) to a new state (three programs including QA Testing), mapping all existing application form fields to the new types.
feature_evidence.json: A feature evidence report mapping implemented features (QA landing page, hero section, target audience section, etc.) to their source files, component dependencies, test IDs, and confidence levels.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: A JSON-formatted text file containing one-sentence summaries of all frontend source files, serving as a reference index for the project's frontend components, pages, and hooks.
frontend/index.css: Defines Tailwind base styles and OKLCH CSS custom properties for light and dark color themes including background, foreground, card, sidebar, and chart variables.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point that sets the page title to 'AI Infrastructure Engineer Accelerator' and mounts the React app via a root div and module script.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Configures TanStack Router with routes for home, /infrastructure, /data-analytics, /qa-testing, /apply, and /apply/success, all nested under a shared Layout component.
frontend/src/components/CareerDemandSect: Displays an 'AI Infrastructure Boom' marketing section with a career growth image, US/Canada salary range ($95K–$180K), and a no-coding-required callout.
frontend/src/components/CareerServicesSe: Renders a grid of six included career services (resume review, mock interviews, job search strategy, LinkedIn optimization, negotiation coaching, career growth planning) with icons and descriptions.
frontend/src/components/CompaniesLogoSec: Shows a section listing six companies (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud, Deloitte, Accenture, IBM) where graduates have interviewed, displayed as icon-and-label tiles in a responsive grid.
frontend/src/components/CurriculumSectio: Renders a 4-phase, 8-month DevOps/cloud curriculum as a 2-column grid of cards, each showing phase name, duration, title, and topic list.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsCar: Displays a 'Career Accelerator Layer' section with six icon-labeled career services (resume, LinkedIn, SQL prep, etc.) in a responsive card grid.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsCur: Renders a 5-phase Data Analytics curriculum in a card grid, each phase showing topics and an outcome statement, with Phase 4 highlighted as AI-focused.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsFAQ: Displays a collapsible FAQ accordion with six common questions about the Data Analytics program, built on a shadcn Accordion component.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsFin: Final call-to-action section urging visitors to apply for the next cohort, with a headline, supporting copy, and a link button to the apply page.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsHer: Hero section for the AI Data & Analytics Accelerator program, featuring a headline, capability icon list, and an apply CTA button over a gradient background.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsOpp: Highlights the market opportunity for data professionals by listing key skills, showing US salary ranges for three roles in cards, and noting AI's amplifying effect.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsPri: Justifies the $2,999 program price with a two-column comparison of what the program is not versus what it includes, ending with an apply CTA.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsPro: Presents the Data Analytics program format (8 months, live sessions, labs, cohort size, etc.) as an icon-card grid with a 'Selective admission' callout.
Displays a grid of five portfolio project cards for the Data Analytics program, each with an icon, title, and description, plus a note about portfolio documentation.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsTar: Shows the target audience for the Data Analytics program as icon cards (e.g., MBA professionals, career switchers) and highlights that no advanced math or coding is required.
frontend/src/components/DataAnalyticsWhy: Explains the motivation for the Data Analytics program by listing five common problems with existing data courses, each shown with an X icon.
frontend/src/components/DifferentiationS: Contrasts what the program is not (bootcamp, generic IT training, self-paced videos) with what it is (a structured AI-era infrastructure program) using X and Check icon cards.
frontend/src/components/FAQSection.tsx: Renders an accordion-style FAQ section with seven questions covering prerequisites, time commitment, job outcomes, payment plans, and program differentiation.
frontend/src/components/FeaturedPrograms: Displays three featured program cards (Infrastructure, Data Analytics, QA Testing) with badges, descriptions, and links to their respective detail pages.
A closing call-to-action section with an 'Apply Now' link and 'Schedule a Call' button, emphasizing limited seats and urgency around the AI infrastructure job market.
frontend/src/components/FutureProofSecti: Argues that infrastructure engineers are AI-proof by listing tasks AI cannot perform and highlighting the strategic thinking, problem-solving, and collaboration skills engineers provide.
frontend/src/components/HeroSection.tsx: The main hero section for the site, featuring a headline about launching a $100K+ AI Infrastructure Engineering career, five skill icons, and Apply/Download CTA buttons.
frontend/src/components/HomeFAQSection.t: A compact home-page FAQ accordion with four questions covering beginner-friendliness, job placement policy, cohort language/timezone, and program differentiation.
Hero section for the homepage featuring a headline, program highlights, and CTA buttons linking to the apply page and a brochure download.
frontend/src/components/HowItWorksSectio: Three-step process section (Apply, Learn, Launch) with icons and CTA buttons for applying or scheduling a free call.
frontend/src/components/ImpactCountersSe: Displays four key program metrics (students enrolled, projects built, 1:1 hours, interview-ready grads) in a grid layout.
frontend/src/components/InstructorSectio: Showcases instructor credentials with an image and three feature cards highlighting certifications, real-world experience, and track record.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: Main app layout with a sticky header (nav with Programs dropdown, Sign In/Up), a footer with a newsletter signup form, and an Outlet for page content.
frontend/src/components/LeadCaptureSecti: Lead capture form card that collects name, email, phone, and preferred call time, showing a success state after submission.
frontend/src/components/PortfolioProject: Grid of four portfolio project cards with images, titles, descriptions, and a GitHub link indicator for each project students will complete.
frontend/src/components/PricingSection.t: Pricing section displaying a $2,999 one-time payment option with a list of included features, an ROI callout, and an apply CTA button.
frontend/src/components/ProgramStructure: Highlights six program structure features (duration, cohort model, limited seats, mentorship, recorded access, community) in icon cards with a phase diagram image.
Displays a 'Real-World Projects' section with five project cards (cloud, data, AI, Kubernetes, CI/CD) and two illustrative images, plus a GitHub portfolio callout.
frontend/src/components/QACareerServices: Renders a 'Career Accelerator Layer' section listing seven career services (resume, LinkedIn, mock interviews, etc.) as icon cards for the QA program.
frontend/src/components/QACurriculumSect: Shows a 12-week QA curriculum broken into three monthly phases (Foundations, Manual/API Testing, Automation), each with topics, outcomes, and project highlights.
frontend/src/components/QAFAQSection.tsx: Renders an accordion-based FAQ section with four questions covering beginner-friendliness, automation inclusion, hiring prospects, and online format for the QA program.
frontend/src/components/QAFinalCTASectio: Displays a final call-to-action section encouraging users to apply for the next QA cohort, with a button linking to the /apply route.
frontend/src/components/QAHeroSection.ts: Hero section for the QA Career Launch Program page, featuring a headline, program highlights (no degree/coding required, manual/API/automation), and a cohort application CTA button.
frontend/src/components/QAOpportunitySec: Highlights why QA is a smart US career entry path, listing industry demand bullet points and displaying salary ranges ($60K–$80K entry-level, $90K+ automation) in cards.
frontend/src/components/QAPricingSection: Presents the QA program pricing ($1,999 one-time) with a list of included features and a link to the application page.
frontend/src/components/QAProgramStructu: Describes the QA program format with icon cards for key details (12 weeks, live sessions, cohort-based, 10–15 hrs/week) and a note emphasizing active participation.
frontend/src/components/QAProjectsSectio: Lists five hands-on portfolio deliverables students will complete (test case repo, defect tracking, API collection, automation scripts, capstone docs) as cards with icons.
frontend/src/components/QATargetAudience: Renders a 'Who This Program Is For' section for a QA program, displaying a grid of target audience cards with icons and a highlighted tagline.
frontend/src/components/TargetAudienceSe: Renders a 'Who This Program Is For' section with a checklist-style grid of target audiences and a 'No Prior Coding Experience Required' callout.
frontend/src/components/TestimonialsSect: Displays a three-column testimonials section with learner quotes, avatars, names, and roles.
Renders a 'Real skills. Real projects. Real hiring support.' section highlighting three core program features with icons.
frontend/src/components/WhyStackTeacherS: Displays a grid of differentiator cards explaining why learners should choose Stack Teacher, each with a checkmark icon.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom hook that creates and caches an ICP backend actor (authenticated or anonymous) using React Query, invalidating dependent queries when the identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useApplicationForm.ts: Custom hook that exposes a `submitApplication` mutation for submitting program applications via the ICP actor, invalidating the applications query on success.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an `InternetIdentityProvider` and `useInternetIdentity` hook for managing DFINITY Internet Identity authentication state, including login, logout, and identity persistence.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Exports React Query hooks `useGetAllApplications` and `useGetApplication` for fetching application data from the ICP backend actor.
frontend/src/index.css: Defines global Tailwind CSS base styles and CSS custom properties for light and dark theme color tokens using OKLCH color space.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that mounts the React app wrapped with `QueryClientProvider` and `InternetIdentityProvider`.
frontend/src/pages/ApplicationForm.tsx: A multi-field application form page that collects program selection, personal info, career status, motivation statement, and preferred start date, then submits via the useApplicationForm hook and navigates to a success page.
frontend/src/pages/ApplicationSuccess.ts: A confirmation page displayed after a successful application submission, outlining the three next steps (review, interview, decision) and a link back to the home page.
frontend/src/pages/DataAnalyticsLandingP: Composes the full landing page for the AI Data & Analytics Engineer Accelerator program by assembling all its section components in order.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Composes the main home page by assembling all homepage section components, serving as the central hub for the Stack Teacher multi-program platform.
frontend/src/pages/LandingPage.tsx: Composes the full landing page for the AI Infrastructure Engineer Accelerator program by assembling all its section components in order.
Composes the full landing page for the QA & Software Testing Career Launch Program by assembling all its section components in order.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining custom design tokens including CSS-variable-based colors, Inter/Cal Sans/JetBrains Mono font families, premium box shadows, border radii, and accordion animations with the tailwindcss-animate and typography plugins.
project_state.json: Tracks the overall project state (version 11) for the Stack Teacher multi-program career accelerator platform, including architectural notes, known issues, and a registry of all implemented features.
